text: True or False? Most vegetable oil contains blends of cooking oils, such as soybean and canola oils.
fullAnswer: False. Most vegetable oil is 100% soybean oil. The majority of shoppers (87%) are more likely to purchase soybean oil after learning the health benefits.1
references: 2015 post-promotion consumer survey conducted by the United Soybean Board.

text: True or false? Soybean oil is the main source of omega-3s and vitamin E in the U.S. diet.
fullAnswer: True.1 It also contributes 0 grams trans fat to products, is high in monounsaturated fats, and has just 2 grams of saturated fat per serving.2
references: PM Kris-Etherton, Denise Shaffer Taylor, et al. "Polyunsaturated fatty acids in the food chain in the United States." AM J Clin Nutr. 2000 Jan; 71(1) 1: 179S-188S.
USDA National Nutrient Database for Standard Reference.

text: True or False? Most soybean oil is made with U.S.-grown soybeans.
fullAnswer: True. Purchase intent rises when shoppers learn that most vegetable oil is U.S.-grown 100% soybean oil; 63% say they would be more likely to purchase a product if it displayed a label stating it was made with 100% U.S.-grown ingredients.
references: 2017 United Soybean Board Food Industry Insights Survey.

text: ____% of consumers said it is important to support domestic agriculture by buying foods produced with crops grown by U.S. farmers.
fullAnswer: C) Sourcing U.S.-grown ingredients, like soybeans, is becoming increasingly important for food companies; 76% of consumers said it is important to support domestic agriculture by buying foods produced with crops grown by U.S. farmers.1
references: 2017 United Soybean Board Food Industry Insights Survey.

text: A large Midwest grocery retailer with 230+ locations reported a ____% unit sales increase over two months* as a result of promoting its store-brand vegetable oil as “U.S.-grown 100% soybean oil.”
fullAnswer: A large Midwest grocery retailer with 230+ locations reported a 27% unit sales increase as a result of promoting its store-brand vegetable oil as U.S.-grown 100% soybean oil.1
references: Sales data reported by large Midwest grocer with 230+ locations.
